title: ICE when using offset_of with an unsized type

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```rust #![feature(offset_of)] use std::fmt::Debug; struct S { a: u64, b: T, } fn main() { let x = core::mem::offset_of!(S>, a); let y = core::mem::offset_of!(S, a); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.71.0-nightly (cca7ee581 2023-05-27) binary: rustc commit-hash: cca7ee58110726983951a19d5fb7316d9243925d commit-date: 2023-05-27 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.71.0-nightly LLVM version: 16.0.4 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: bx.cx().type_is_sized(ty)', /rustc/cca7ee58110726983951a19d5fb7316d9243925d/compiler/rustc_codegen_ssa/src/mir/rvalue.rs:671:17 ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: bx.cx().type_is_sized(ty)', /rustc/cca7ee58110726983951a19d5fb7316d9243925d/compiler/rustc_codegen_ssa/src/mir/rvalue.rs:671:17 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f61ea3698b1 -
